diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Congenital hypothyroidism due to PAX8 mutation
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The presence of a heterozygous inactivating PAX8 mutation (p.K80_A84dup) in the patient with a thyroid histology showing absent or very small follicles resembling fetal thyroid tissue indicates disrupted thyroid follicular growth. This mutation was detected in both the lymphocytes and the thyroid, consistent with a somatic mosaic state, and supports the conclusion of congenital hypothyroidism.
